491: Position Overview This position assists the learning & development portfolio in administrative tasks such as support of content roll out/trainings, supporting system administration, support of performance management program, research/information gathering, and other initiatives. This position may perform additional ad-hoc admin duties as needed for the People & Culture (P&C) team. This position reports and operates at the direction of the Senior Manager, People Analytics, People & Culture. This position is based in Washington, DC (hybrid schedule). Essential Functions Support system administration as it relates to the performance management platform within the HRIS (i.e., distribution of reviews, template updates, auditing, etc.) Support system administration as it relates to the learning management system (LMS), including external partners portal (i.e., auditing, template uploads, etc.) Run reports as needed and directed within multiple platforms; format and/or synthesize data as needed Assist in reviewing, tracking, and documenting compliance with mandatory and non-mandatory training, continuing education, and work assessments Assist in the scheduling and logistics of training and development sessions for UNF employees, including in-person and/or virtual convenings (i.e., compliance trainings, professional development, brown bags, etc.) Assist in the creation and preparation of materials for training/performance management initiatives Conduct research on an as needed basis at the direction of the Senior Manager File employee documentation in the appropriate folders/systems. Serve as administrative backup for P&C coverage when needed Maintain working knowledge of the UNF agreement process (for both contracts and grants), and when to utilize the proper templates accordingly. (As applicable to the role) Draft and review agreements and maintain an understanding of all agreement terms and applicable flow-downs, consulting with UNF’s finance/contracts team as needed. (As applicable to the role) Attend training sessions provided by UNF’s contracts team to maintain and keep up to date with UNF’s current policies and procedures. (As applicable to the role) Maintain a strong knowledge of UNF’s Salesforce database to be able to process and track agreements, extract information, and prepare reports. (As applicable to the role) Other duties as assigned. Selection Criteria Bachelor’s degree required.
